newsitem.title: USA: PRT Group plans Hartford expansion, 200 new jobs.
newsitem.headline: PRT Group plans Hartford expansion, 200 new jobs.

text.p: New York-based software company PRT Group Inc said Wednesday it will expand to the greater Hartford area and hire more than 200 new employees by 1998.
PRT, a privately held company founded in 1989, gave no details about the size of its investment.
The company said in a statement that it will lease 35,000 square feet of space in Windsor, Conn., where it plans to open its Hartford Development Center in July.

PRT provides information technology solutions in various fields including the so-called "year 2000 problem." Its clients include trading, insurance, banking, pharmaceutical and telecommunications companies.
The 200 new employees will include software professionals and support staff.
PRT said it expected 1997 sales to reach $60 million, compared with $20 million last year.
The company said it is receiving $1.20 million in financing from the state of Connecticut in the form of a low-interest loan.
